body:
OpenCV 3.1 doesn't define cvRound in C, only in C++. Thus, we now need
to compile av_test as C++ code.

comment_data.body: Shouldn't that be "greater or equal to" instead?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -288,6 +288,11 @@ if(NOT WIN32 AND BUILD_TOXAV AND SNDFILE_FOUND AND PORTAUDIO_FOUND AND OPENCV_FO
     ${OPENCV_LIBRARIES}
     ${PORTAUDIO_LIBRARIES}
     ${SNDFILE_LIBRARIES})
+  # Due to https://github.com/opencv/opencv/issues/6585, we need to compile
+  # av_test as C++ for newer OpenCV versions.
+  if(OPENCV_VERSION VERSION_GREATER 3)

comment_data.body: I think 3.1 is greater than 3. I don't know whether 3 works, but we got the bug report for 3.1. I'll make it "not less than", which is greater equal.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -288,6 +288,11 @@ if(NOT WIN32 AND BUILD_TOXAV AND SNDFILE_FOUND AND PORTAUDIO_FOUND AND OPENCV_FO
     ${OPENCV_LIBRARIES}
     ${PORTAUDIO_LIBRARIES}
     ${SNDFILE_LIBRARIES})
+  # Due to https://github.com/opencv/opencv/issues/6585, we need to compile
+  # av_test as C++ for newer OpenCV versions.
+  if(OPENCV_VERSION VERSION_GREATER 3)

@@ -288,6 +288,11 @@ if(NOT WIN32 AND BUILD_TOXAV AND SNDFILE_FOUND AND PORTAUDIO_FOUND AND OPENCV_FO
     ${OPENCV_LIBRARIES}
     ${PORTAUDIO_LIBRARIES}
     ${SNDFILE_LIBRARIES})
+  # Due to https://github.com/opencv/opencv/issues/6585, we need to compile
+  # av_test as C++ for newer OpenCV versions.
+  if(OPENCV_VERSION VERSION_GREATER 3)

@@ -288,6 +288,11 @@ if(NOT WIN32 AND BUILD_TOXAV AND SNDFILE_FOUND AND PORTAUDIO_FOUND AND OPENCV_FO
     ${OPENCV_LIBRARIES}
     ${PORTAUDIO_LIBRARIES}
     ${SNDFILE_LIBRARIES})
+  # Due to https://github.com/opencv/opencv/issues/6585, we need to compile
+  # av_test as C++ for newer OpenCV versions.
+  if(OPENCV_VERSION VERSION_GREATER 3)

comment_regular_data.body: I assume we want to support OpenCV 3 then.

commit.message:
Work around bug in opencv3 headers.

OpenCV 3.1 doesn't define cvRound in C, only in C++. Thus, we now need
to compile av_test as C++ code.
